conclusion: Determine the magnitude of the Ampere force on the rod at the initial moment.
Calculate the induced EMF as the rod moves with velocity v, cutting across magnetic field lines.
Induced EMF is given by emf = B * L * v.
The total resistance in the circuit is 2R.
Calculate the induced current using Ohmâ€™s Law: I = emf / 2R.
Calculate the Ampere force on the rod due to the current in the magnetic field.
Ampere force F = B * I * L.
Substitute the value of I: F = B * ((B * L * v) / (2R)) * L.
Final expression for Ampere force: F = (B^2 * L^2 * v) / (2R).
The magnitude of the Ampere force on the rod at the initial moment is (B^2 * L^2 * v) / (2R).
